name: Leicester City FC History Trivia Game | Leicester City | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1884.

	Upon formation, the club were known as Leicester Fosse. They changed their name to Leicester City in 1919.

questions.text: Where did the club first play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Victoria Park.

	The club played at Victoria Park from 1884 to 1887, then at Belgrave Road for one season, before going back to Victoria Park until 1891 when they made Filbert Street their permanent home. Leicester moved into The Walkers Stadium in 2002.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Frank Gardener.

	Gardener was the manager between 1884-94, followed by Marson (1892-94), Lee (1894-95), and Jackson 1895-97). Leicester have had some famous managers in their history, including Martin O'Neill, Brian Little, David Pleat and Dave Bassett.

questions.text: Which of these played the most League games for the club?
questions.explanation:
Adam Black.

	Black played 528 League games between 1920-35.

questions.text: How many FA Cup finals did Leicester appear in, during the 1940s, 50s and 60s?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Amazingly, they lost them all! Their first appearance was in 1949, when they were beaten 3-1 by Wolverhampton Wanderers. 12 years later, they were there again, beaten by double-winning champions Tottenham Hotspur in the 1961 final, 2-0. Another two years passed, and this time it was Manchester United, who beat them 3-1. Manchester City were the victors in 1969, with a 1-0 win.

questions.text: Who did Leicester beat 10-0 to set a record for their biggest League victory in 1928?
questions.explanation:
Portsmouth.

	The game took place on 20th October, 1928. Leicester went on to finish 2nd in the old Division One, just one point behind The Wednesday.

questions.text: In which season were the club first elected into the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1894-95.

	Leicester Fosse (as they were then known), went on to finish in 4th position in the 1894-95 Division Two season, with 38 points from 30 games, 10 points behind title winners Bury.

questions.text: Which of these footballers scored the most League goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Rowley.

	Rowley scored 44 League goals in the 1956-57 Division Two season.

questions.text: From which club did Leicester sign Andy Impey in 1998?
questions.explanation:
West Ham United.

	Impey began his career with non-League Yeading in 1989, and was quickly snapped up by Queens Park Rangers a year later, where he played until signing for West Ham United in 1997. He signed for Leicester on 24th November, 1998.

questions.text: Who did Leicester Cirt beat in the 1964 League Cup final?
questions.explanation:
Stoke City.

	Leicester won the League Cup three times in the 20th century, with a 4-3 aggregate win over Stoke in 1964, a 1-0 win over Middlesbrough in 1997, and a 2-1 victory over Tranmere in 2000. They were also losing finalists twice, in 1965, 3-2 on aggregate to Chelsea, and in 1999 when Tottenham were the victors, thanks to a single goal.
